Detailed Description

Thread class.

This class that encapsulates a platform-specific thread facility.

Member Function Documentation

void *  arg 
) [private]

Operating-system-level function that creates and runs a new Thread.

Parameters:
[in] threadFunc : the Thread main function
[in] arg : argument to the Thread main function
Returns:
identification of the Thread just created
static threadfunc proxyThreadFunc ( void *  _parm  )  [private]

Auxiliary function used to start a new Thread.

Parameters:
[in] _parm : parameter passed to the Thread main function

Definition at line 238 of file Thread.c.

00239 {
00240    // the only reason for the existence of this function is to initialize the
00241    // thread-local-storage (TLS) variable currentThreadSeqNo, which provides
00242    // platform-independent way of identifying threads; it could be used to
00243    // provide other pre-activation thread initialization
00244 
00245    // parameter received by this proxy threadfunc
00246    ThreadParm* threadParm = (ThreadParm*)_parm;
00247 
00248    // this is the real threadfunc
00249    ThreadFunc threadFunc = threadParm->threadFunc;
00250 
00251    // this is the real parm
00252    void* parm = threadParm->parm;
00253 
00254    // call free ThreadParm now, doesn't need it anymore
00255    free(threadParm);
00256 
00257    currentThreadSeqNo = ++currentSeqNo;
00258 
00259    // finally, runs the user thread...
00260    return threadFunc(parm);
00261 }

TC2API void thread_addThreads ( uint  n,
ThreadFunc  threadFunc,
void *  parm 
)

Starts n instances of a Thread.

Parameters:
n : the number of instances of a Thread to instantiate
threadFunc : the main Thread function of the Threads being instantiated
parm : the parameter passes to the main Thread function being instantiated

Definition at line 96 of file Thread.c.

00097 {
00098    uint i;
00099 
00100    log_func(thread_addThreads);
00101    log_finfo("adding %d threads", n);
00102 
00103    if (n == 0)
00104       log_fwarn("strange, adding 0 threads here...");
00105 
00106    for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00107    {
00108       ThreadParm* threadParm = (ThreadParm*)calloc(1, sizeof(ThreadParm));
00109       assert(threadParm);
00110 
00111       threadParm->threadFunc = threadFunc;
00112       threadParm->parm = parm;
00113 
00114       // platform-specific creation of a thread running the proxy function
00115       log_finfo("creating a thread");
00116       createThread(proxyThreadFunc, threadParm);
00117    }
00118 }
